meanings.definition: people who are unable to read or write.
meanings.sent1: Many illiterates struggle to fill out job applications.
meanings.sent2: The illiterates in the village are attending literacy classes.
meanings.sent3: The illiterates at the library were looking at picture books.
meanings.sent4: In a world of words, illiterates are like lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: Illiterates face challenges in accessing information and education.

meanings.definition: lacking knowledge or understanding in a particular subject or area.
meanings.sent1: The illiterates students had difficulty with the math problems.
meanings.sent2: She felt illiterates in the world of technology.
meanings.sent3: The illiterates chef burned the toast every morning.
meanings.sent4: His illiterates grasp of history made studying difficult.
meanings.sent5: The illiterates driver got lost on the way to the airport.
